oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Preachers; Public speaking; Crowds; Spectators
Evolution (Biology) -- Religious aspects; Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A crowd listens in the streets to a preacher giving a soap box oratory.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: TSLA Staff
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This preacher was standing, on his soapbox, about one block from the Rhea County Courthouse. A soapbox is a raised platform on which one stands to make an impromptu speech, often about a political subject.
